comments.body: does that mean i can't pass both `"sync"` and `"ne"`?

Mmmm yes currently it's like that. "sync" and "ne" work on two different aspects (supposing chain and entrylist have the same sub files/lists vs avoiding retrieving full paths to files), so I even if one wrote them together the "sync" option would always take precedence and route the SetEntryList function to its own route.

What do you think? Should I add in the document that the two options don't mix with each other? Or something else?
afaict the two options are orthogonal so there is no reason they can't both be specified?

I understand your point but I think even if one specified "sync ne" the sync option would branch out and call
`templist = static_cast<TEntryList*>(subentrylists->At(ie))`, so the "ne" option would be completely ignored anyway because it should be passed to the function `TEntryList::GetEntryList` which is called only if the sync option is not active (line 2762)
